title: U.S. Strikes India Deal in Bid to Loosen China’s Grip on Solar Panels
sub_head: Foreign-development agency aims to bolster alternatives to China’s solar-industry supply chain
body: A U.S. foreign-development agency intended to counter Beijing’s dollar diplomacy is lending $500 million to build a solar-panel factory in India, putting American taxpayer money behind a bid to weaken China’s dominance of the solar industry’s supply chain.
